Class GameScene

java.lang.Object
GameScene
Direct Known Subclasses:
BedroomScene, CreditsScene, InfoScene, InventoryScene, KitchenScene, LoadAndNewGameScene, LoadGameScene, MainMenuScene, ParentControlPasswordScene, ParentControlsScene, PetInfoScene, PetNameScene, PetSelectionScene, PlaygroundScene, SettingsScene, TutorialScene, VetScene
public abstract class GameScene extends Object
The parent class for all scenes in the game.

This class is mostly used for the screen manager class. It provides the empty methods for many methods on gameplay screens that must be accessed through the screen manager. There are no functional methods in this class.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameScene

      public GameScene()

  • Method Details

    • onTimerTick

      public void onTimerTick()
      Represents the events that occur after every few seconds.

      Every few seconds, the pet's stats besides health will decrease. Additionally, the pet will gain coins. The pet's states and UI will be updated accordingly.

    • onSleepTick

      public void onSleepTick()
      Represents the events that occur when the pet is sleeping.

      This timer is called when the pet starts sleeping, and is no longer called when the pet stops sleeping. This timer will continuously check if the pet is still sleeping, and if so, will increase the pet's energy value. If not, the gameplay buttons will be enabled again, assuming all other conditions are met.

    • onAngryTick

      public void onAngryTick()
      Represents the events that occur when the pet is angry.

      This timer is called when the pet is angry, and is no longer called when the pet is no longer angry. This timer will continuously check if the pet is still angry. If not, the gameplay buttons will be enabled again, assuming all other conditions are met.

    • onPlayCooldownTick

      public void onPlayCooldownTick()
      Represents the cooldown for the play button in the playground class.

      This cooldown is called when the play button is pressed, and is no longer called when the cooldown reaches 0. Every second, the cooldown is decreased until it reaches 0. When that happens, the play button will be enabled.

    • onVetCooldownTick

      public void onVetCooldownTick()
      Represents the cooldown for the vet button in the vet class.

      This cooldown is called when the vet button is pressed, and is no longer called when the cooldown reaches 0. Every second, the cooldown is decreased until it reaches 0. When that happens, the vet button will be enabled.

    • onEnter

      public void onEnter()
      Represents the events that occur when the scene is entered.

      On scene entry, all UI elements are brought from the previous scene to maintain consistency. Additionally, the stat decrease timer will start. If there are any buttons that require a condition to work, this method also checks for that condition. It updates the buttons clickablility and the pet's states accordingly.

    • setPetType_ForPetNameSceneOnly

      public void setPetType_ForPetNameSceneOnly(String name)
      Sets the pet type so it can be used to create a pet in the pet name scene class.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the pet type.

    • getPet

      Sets the pet object for a certain scene. Used in gameScene.setPet(pet).
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      The pet overlay object for a certain scene.
      See Also:
      • PetOverlay

    • updatePetState

      protected void updatePetState()
      Updates the pet's states upon every stat increase or decrease.

      If the pet is dead, all buttons besides settings are no longer functional. If the pet is angry, all buttons that don't increase happiness are not functional. If the pet is sleeping, all buttons besides settings are no longer functional, and the pet will receive a health penalty. If the pet is hungry, they will lose health and happiness over time.

    • setTotalPlaytimetext

      public void setTotalPlaytimetext(String text)
      Sets the total playtime text for parental controls.

      This text is displayed on the screen to indicate the total playtime of the game.

      Parameters:
      text - The text representing the total playtime.

    • getNewGameButton

      public javafx.scene.control.Button getNewGameButton()
      Retrieves the "New Game" button.

      This button is used to start a new game and may be disabled based on parental control settings.

      Returns:
      The button used to start a new game.

    • getLoadGameButton

      public javafx.scene.control.Button getLoadGameButton()
      Retrieves the "Load Game" button.

      This button is used to load a previously saved game and may be disabled based on parental control settings.

      Returns:
      The button used to load a saved game.

    • getWelcomeText

      public javafx.scene.text.Text getWelcomeText()
      Retrieves the welcome text displayed on the new and load game screen.

      This text provides a greeting or instructions to the player before they start or load a game.

      Returns:
      The welcome text displayed on the screen.
